title: Iron Changes Architecture Forever
description: A quick win: understand Iron Changes Architecture Forever.

hook.text: In 1779, the world's first iron bridge opened in England. People came from across Europe just to stare at it.

buildup.text: Cast iron could span distances stone never could. Factories, train stations, and markets all rushed to use it.

discovery.text: Iron columns replaced thick walls, freeing up floor space. Open-plan buildings became possible for the first time.

twist.text: But cast iron was brittleâ€”it cracked under tension. The 1847 Dee Bridge collapse killed five and exposed the flaw.

climax.text: Wrought iron and later steel solved the brittleness problem, setting the stage for skyscrapers.

punchline.text: Iron broke architecture's height limitâ€”and a few bridges.
